headline: NXP Refocuses On Auto Connectivity With MEMS Exit And Aviva Links Deal
summary: NXP Semiconductors has completed the sale of its MEMS sensors business. The company has acquired Aviva Links to expand its automotive connectivity capabilities. These moves adjust NXP's portfolio focus toward higher connectivity content in vehicles. NXP Semiconductors (NasdaqGS:NXPI) is reshaping its portfolio, with the MEMS sensors sale and the acquisition of Aviva Links signaling a sharper focus on automotive connectivity. The stock last closed at $231.08, with a 1 year return of 15.0%...
